messages.message:
Hey all! IBReviewer prototype is live now :tada:. From now on, it'll be visible as another github action by the name (:robot_face: *IBReviewer / AI Code Review (experimental)*) running in every PR. It'll post suggestion messages in your PR.

Current capabilities:
• Review and comment on files individually, no file has context of another file for now. (We plan to iterate and improve on it.)
• Only reviews python files.
• Skips reviewing empty files, moved files, _pb2.py files.
• Post the review comments as part of a single comment instead of discussion thread.
• This won't block merge.
Future improvements:
• Better context handling (compression, parsing of code etc.) to reduce context bloat with bigger code files.
• Smarter module detection taking code structure into account.
• Supporting more languages like golang, TS, JS etc.
• Support reviewing test coverage and test relevance.
Current limits (to be addressed as part of above improvements):
• Posts max 50 comments per run.
• Upto 30 files will be reviewed per run.
• Reviews changes to files with <1000 lines of code only, it'll skip files with code greater than that.
Please feel free to share any feedback/issues in this (https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1f1yuzqspFhzFvrRwPmYarGatJbKZ21oivhGbtoFVV8k/edit?gid=0#gid=0) sheet, we'll actively keep monitoring it & iterating to improve it and make it smarter.
